translated: And it cannot be written, recited, borne in mind, read aloud, honored, revered, respected, or worshipped by beings who have not planted the roots of virtue.

original: anyatra bahubuddhāvaropitakuśalamūlās te sattvā bhaviṣyanti ya imaṃ prajñāpāramitānayamukham dharmaparyāyam antaśa ekākṣaram api śroṣyanti
analyzed: anyatra bahu buddha avaropita kuśala mūlāḥ te sattvāḥ bhaviṣyanti ye imam prajñāpāramitā naya mukham dharmaparyāyam antaśas eka akṣaram api śroṣyanti
translated: On the other hand, those beings will have planted the roots of virtue with many buddhas, who will hear even a single syllable of this Dharma discourse that is the gateway to the perfection of wisdom,

original: kiṃ punaḥ sakalaṃ parisamāptam /🔽yena kenacid vajrapāṇe 'śītigaṅgānadīvālukāsamāni buddhakoṭiniyutaśatasahasrāṇi na
analyzed: kim punar sakalam parisamāptam  yena kenacid vajrapāṇe śīti gaṅgā nadī vālukā samāni buddha koṭi niyuta śata sahasrāṇi na
translated: let alone the entire complete [text].🔽Vajrapāṇi, by whomever this Dharma discourse that is the gateway to the perfection of wisdom,

original: satkṛtāni na gurukṛtāni na mānitāni na pūjitāni bhavanti tena na śakyo 'ayaṃ prajñāpāramitānayamukho
analyzed: satkṛtāni na gurukṛtāni na mānitāni na pūjitāni bhavanti tena na śakyaḥ ayam prajñāpāramitā naya mukhaḥ
translated: this Dharma discourse, has not been honored, revered, respected, or worshipped as if it were eighty koṭis of nayutas of hundreds of thousands of buddhas,

analyzed: dharmaparyāyaḥ śrotum
translated: by them this Dharma discourse cannot be heard.

original: tasmāc caityabhūtaḥ pṛthivīpradeśo bhaviṣyati yatrāyaṃ dharmaparyāyaḥ pracariṣyati /
analyzed: tasmāt caitya bhūtaḥ pṛthivī pradeśaḥ bhaviṣyati yatra ayam dharmaparyāyaḥ pracariṣyati
translated: And that place on earth will become a caitya where this Dharma teaching will be practiced.

original: vandanīyaś ca sa pudgalo bahukalpakoṭī bhaviṣyati yasyāyaṃ dharmaparyāyaḥ kāyagato vā pustakagato vā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: vandanīyaḥ ca sa pudgalaḥ bahu kalpa koṭī bhaviṣyati yasya ayam dharmaparyāyaḥ kāya gataḥ vā pustaka gataḥ vā bhaviṣyati
translated: That person who has this Dharma teaching either in their body or in a book will be one to whom many millions of eons of birth will be paid homage.

analyzed: jātismaraḥ ca bahu kalpa koṭī bhaviṣyati
translated: They will remember many millions of eons of birth.

original: na cāsya māraḥ pāpīyān antarāyaṃ kariṣyati /
analyzed: na ca asya māraḥ pāpīyān antarāyam kariṣyati
translated: And Mara, the evil one, will not create obstacles for them.

original: catvāraś cāsya mahārājānaḥ pṛṣṭhataḥ pṛṣṭhataḥ samanubaddhā bhaviṣyanti rakṣāvaraṇaguptaye anyāś ca devatāḥ /
analyzed: catvāraḥ ca asya mahā rājānaḥ pṛṣṭhatas pṛṣṭhatas samanubaddhāḥ bhaviṣyanti rakṣā āvaraṇa guptaye anyāḥ ca devatāḥ
translated: And the four great kings will be bound to their rear to provide protection, defense, and guard, as well as other gods.

analyzed: na ca viṣama a parihāreṇa kālam kariṣyati
translated: And they will not die an untimely death due to avoiding danger.

analyzed: sarva buddha bodhisattva samanvāhṛtaḥ ca bhaviṣyati
translated: And they will be blessed by all the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas.

original: samāsato yatra buddhakṣetre ākāṅkṣiṣyate tatra tatropapatsyate /
analyzed: samāsatas yatra buddhakṣetre ākāṅkṣiṣyate tatra tatra upapatsyate
translated: In brief, wherever they wish to be reborn in a Buddha-field, they will be reborn there.

analyzed: evam bahu anuśaṃsaḥ prajñāpāramitā naya mukhaḥ dharmaparyāyaḥ
translated: Thus, the Dharma teaching of the method of the perfection of wisdom has many benefits.

original: api ca pradeśamātraṃ mayā kīrtitam iti //
analyzed: api ca pradeśa mātram mayā kīrtitam iti
translated: Moreover, I have declared only a part of it.

analyzed: idam avocat bhagavān
translated: The Blessed One said this.

original: āttamanaso vajrapāṇipramukhā bodhisattvā mahāsattvāḥ sā ca sarvāvatī parṣat sadevamānuṣāsuragandharvaś ca loko bhagavato bhāṣitam abhyanandan
analyzed: ātta manasaḥ vajrapāṇi pramukhāḥ bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ sā ca sarvāvatī parṣad sa deva mānuṣa asura gandharvaḥ ca lokaḥ bhagavataḥ bhāṣitam abhyanandan
translated: The Bodhisattva Mahasattvas headed by Vajrapani became delighted in mind, and the entire assembly, together with the world of gods, humans, asuras, and gandharvas, rejoiced in and praised the Blessed One's teaching.

analyzed: iti adhyardhaśatikā bhagavatī prajñāpāramitā samāptā
translated: Thus ends the Blessed One's Perfection of Wisdom in One and a Half Chapters.
